marklogic.body:
Â I live in a city with fairly strict zoning.Â A few years ago, the people across the street from me decided to start a home delivery business out of their home.Â Huge trucks began showing up at any time of day, making deliveries of milk, bread, eggs, and so on, which they stored in their basement.Â They would then load these into small vans for delivery in the city.Â The large trucks completely blocked our narrow streets while they were unloading.Â The traffic got much busier due to the delivery vans, and the comings of goings of the people who worked for them.Â It became almost impossible to find a parking Spot.Â Needless to say, it was a gigantic mess.
We complained to our city councilwoman, who talked to the people.Â They refused to shut down.Â She then took them to court, which shut them down immediately.
Obviously, I am very Glad we have zoning.Â Negative externalities can be huge.
